#Text=Garden in the Tropics
#Text=Gardening is a fun and rewarding hobby that will also offer self-satisfaction .
#Text=There ’s nothing like planting a seed and watching it grow into a full plant .
#Text=Tropical gardening is not much different than any other types of gardening .
#Text=Plants still share the same basic needs : healthy soil , water , and proper fertilization .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Preparing for Gardening
#Text=Research your area 's climates and plants that grow well there .
#Text=Find out what plants do well in the tropics and make sure they can withstand any difficulties they could face .
#Text=Research the native plants in your area .
#Text=Native plants tend to grow more successfully in your area as they can grow in every condition that your area gives .
#Text=They also can adapt to changes more easily than other plants .
#Text=Research your area 's weather conditions .
#Text=This way , you 'll be able to better assess your plants ' needs
#Text=Pick a location that provides for the necessities of your plants .
#Text=This one matters the most when the preparation is brought to mind .
#Text=You should assess the following :
#Text=The amount of sunlight exposure during the day .
#Text=The location must receive the right amount of sunlight exposure , depending on what kind of plants you want to grow .
#Text=Some plants need less sunlight while others require more .
#Text=The texture of the soil .
#Text=For the most part , plants do well in loamy , well-draining soil .
#Text=The fertility content of the soil , however , does depend on your plants .
#Text=Prepare the necessary materials .
#Text=You should have the following at hand :
#Text=Rake
#Text=Spade or shovel
#Text=Fertilizer
#Text=Water
#Text=Seeds ( purchase them from gardening stores or get seeds from fruits/existing plants )
#Text=Prepare the area .
#Text=Remove any weeds and debris of any kind .
#Text=Till the soil for at least deep .
#Text=Work the fertilizer ( or the kitchen waste if you ca n't find fertilizer ) into the soil .
#Text=Rake the fertilizer all over the area .
#Text=Poke holes , about apart from each other .
#Text=Start planting .
#Text=Insert seeds into the holes .
#Text=Remember , the planting depth and space requirements may differ from one plant to another , so take them into consideration when doing this .
#Text=Among the major field crops , oats , wheat , and rye are sown , grasses and legumes are seeded , and maize and soybeans are planted .
#Text=Cover the seeds lightly with soil .
#Text=Water generously until germination .
#Text=Caring for the Plants
#Text=Apply weed and feed regularly .
#Text=This will keep weeds from germinating in your yard .
#Text=People and pets should stay away from the treatment areas during weed and feed application , and until the product 's dust settles .
#Text=Wear protective clothing including gloves , long sleeves , and long pants when you use weed and feed products .
#Text=Mulch the plants .
#Text=This will retain moisture and hinder the growth .
#Text=You can lay down dead leaves from trees nearby .
#Text=Soil amendment can also be used as mulch .
#Text=You should always be prepared for problems that may occur in the garden , such as :
#Text=Pests .
#Text=You can eliminate them by planting attractants for predacious creatures or by using organic pesticides .
#Text=Diseases .
#Text=You can eliminate them by having a schedule and keeping it consistent ( ex . a watering schedule ) .
#Text=Some diseases could infect and kill plants easily , so getting rid of the problem at an earlier stage will ensure your peace of mind .
#Text=Excessive heat .
#Text=Although plants generally like the sun , they can get overwhelmed if they 're being exposed to it for too long .
#Text=Covering them or determining the perfect location can defeat the excessive heat of the sun .
#Text=Stress .
#Text=Plants can get stressed when crowded , provided the least amount of their needs or the wrong requirements for them to survive .
#Text=This can be solved by planning carefully before beginning the plantation .
#Text=Enjoy your wonderful garden !
#Text=Following these steps will ensure you a happier experience and a bountiful garden .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't use any chemicals on your plants .
#Text=This will harm and kill plants and other insects that are helping your garden flourish .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=Rake
#Text=Spade or shovel
#Text=Fertilizer
#Text=Water
#Text=Seeds ( purchase them from gardening stores or get seeds from fruits/existing plants )
